category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: in the agenda for sustainable development to end all forms of violence against children gives renewed impetus towards the realization of the right of every child to live free from fear neglect abuse and exploitation
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: several other sdg targets address specific forms of violence and harm towards children such as child marriage and female genital mutilation target
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: and the eradication of child labor including the recruitment and use of child soldiers target
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: to gain a better understanding of the nature extent and causes of violence against children and of measures designed to increase their protection the united nations conducted a comprehensive study in with clear recommendations for action
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: the secretary general appointed a special representative on violence against children to monitor progress on implementation of the recommendations of the study and ensure its effective follow up
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: one billion children globally experience some form of emotional physical or sexual violence every year and one child dies as a result of violence every five minutes
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: although of epidemic proportions violence against children often remains hidden and socially condoned
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: violence against children knows no boundaries of culture class education income or ethnic origin
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: it takes place in institutions designed for their care and protection in schools online and also within the home
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: most girls and boys who are exposed to violence live in isolation loneliness and fear and do not know where to turn for help especially when the perpetrator is someone close and on whom they depend for their protection and well being
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: younger children are especially at risk from violence as they are less able to speak up and seek support and it can cause irreversible damage to their development
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: gender disability poverty or national or ethnic origin are some of the risk factors that can place children at high risk of violence
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: peer on peer violence by children is also a concern with studies showing that between per cent of children have been victims of bullying
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: the growth in cyberbullying is equally troubling with its harmful messages spreading fast and far and fueled by perpetrators anonymity
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: violence has serious and long lasting consequences for its victims and can have a major impact on the health development and school performance of children
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: it also slows social progress by generating huge economic costs hindering sustainable development and eroding human capital
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: according to one study the global costs of violence against children could be as high as us trillion per year
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: violence against children can be prevented and there has been real progress over recent years as highlighted by the global survey on violence against children and the annual reports of the special representative of the secretary general to the general assembly
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: in support of the sustainable development agenda targets new partnerships and alliances are forming new international standards on children s protection from violence including trafficking sexual abuse and exploitation have been adopted a large number of states have adopted a national comprehensive policy agenda on violence prevention and response and enacted legislation to prohibit physical mental and sexual violence and to safeguard the rights of child victims information campaigns have raised awareness of the negative impact of violence on child development and of positive practices to prevent its occurrence and children s protection from bullying domestic violence sexual violence and harmful practices are being tackled through new global initiatives
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: there is also increased investment in generating sound evidence on the scale and nature of violence against children and on effective strategies to prevent it and in promoting and monitoring progress towards its elimination
category: Goal 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Instiutions

text_data: the agenda for sustainable development presents us with an historic opportunity to place the protection of children at the heart of the policy actions of every nation and to build a world where all children everywhere enjoy freedom from fear and from violence in all its forms
